means: 小偷，盗贼( thief的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: Thieves ransacked the office, taking a sack of loose change.
sentence.Network_cn: 窃贼洗劫了办公室,拿走了一口袋散币.

sentence.Network_en: Unknown thieves had forced their way into the apartment.
sentence.Network_cn: 不知名的窃贼破门闯入了公寓。

sentence.Network_en: He returned from hospital to find thieves had ransacked his home.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从医院回来，发现家里被小偷洗劫一空。

entry.def: A thief is a person who steals something from another person.

auth_sentence.content: He added, ruefully: We are all thieves.

Sentence.sentence: Just because some students have stolen things in shops, all of us are treated like thieves.
We were not only assumed to be thieves, but brilliant, greedy thieves
